0AD61AD5D0804B0FB26DE5F954B4AF98.description: A student recognises and uses an increasing range of strategies to reflect on their own and others’ learning

DB34D977D8F74BCF8D24C483A3D51623.description: A student responds to and composes a range of texts that express viewpoints of the world similar to and different from their own

E97358F38C5E4431BB95D2EDFBCDF9A8.description: A student thinks imaginatively, creatively and interpretively about information, ideas and texts when responding to and composing texts

10B36C1B1CFB40E796C8D23F8C15E6BB.description: A student uses effective and accurate sentence structure, grammatical features, punctuation conventions and vocabulary relevant to the type of text when responding to and composing texts

1B6E7E26F03749029BA4BD2511A33F3E.description: A student identifies and compares different kinds of texts when reading and viewing and shows an understanding of purpose, audience and subject matter

13420465F72F4646A69099D6E46B179B.description: A student identifies and uses language forms and features in their own writing appropriate to a range of purposes, audiences and contexts

5695A60B67FE4E15B02269B3669C3709.description: A student identifies the effect of purpose and audience on spoken texts, distinguishes between different forms of English and identifies organisational patterns and features

4C34E5EF506B45A18E1A805135E10F3E.description: A student uses an increasing range of skills, strategies and knowledge to fluently read, view and comprehend a range of texts on increasingly challenging topics in different media and technologies

D190E755FBD84921B49434E955E7B77F.description: A student plans, composes and reviews a range of texts that are more demanding in terms of topic, audience and language

65D76DD09AD14F2A8A8CD7C96285A818.description: A student communicates in a range of informal and formal contexts by adopting a range of roles in group, classroom, school and community contexts
